revised_title: Crystallo-Optical Investigation of Nitrogen, Argon, Methane, and Organic Compounds with Low Melting Points
tldr: The author develops a method for studying the crystallographic properties of gaseous elements and organic compounds at low temperatures using quartz-glass crystallization vessels. The study focuses on nitrogen, argon, methane, and simpler organic compounds with low melting points, providing insights into their crystal structures and optical properties.
